text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly discusses the Italian legal framework, including moral rights (Art. 12-15 of Law 633/1941). Under the analysis for variant (c) (worker-rights activist outfit), the response states that a political appropriation is unlikely to qualify as parody because Italian courts require the parody to be recognizable as a joke or critique of the original, and a mere 'political costume' is unlikely to qualify. This directly addresses the concept that associating a copyrighted work with an external cause (like a political movement) without it being a genuine critique/parody of the work itself is a violation, which aligns with the right to integrity.", "criterion_id": "72f92aac-0d46-4c0e-a5ca-990c3e6c5a46"}
